description.plain:
Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch was an American hip-hop group led by Mark Wahlberg (brother of Donnie Wahlberg of New Kids on the Block). The Funky Bunch consisted of Wahlberg, Scott Ross, Hector Barros (Hector the Booty Inspector), Terry Yancey, and Anthony Thomas.

The group finally broke up after 1993, where which Wahlberg eventually became an actor.

name: Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch

body.plain:
Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch was an American hip-hop group led by Mark Wahlberg (brother of Donnie Wahlberg of New Kids on the Block). The Funky Bunch consisted of Wahlberg, Scott Ross, Hector Barros (Hector the Booty Inspector), Terry Yancey, and Anthony Thomas.

The group finally broke up after 1993, where which Wahlberg eventually became an actor.

songs.artist_names: Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch (Ft. Loleatta Holloway)
songs.full_title: Good Vibrations by Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch (Ft. Loleatta Holloway)
songs.title: Good Vibrations

primary_artist.name: Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch

description.plain:
“Good Vibrations”, a #1 song in the US, Denmark, Sweden & Switzerland in the fall of 1991, was the result of a promise made to Mark Wahlberg by his brother Donnie, who was on tour at the time with the indescribably successful New Kids On The Block.

Donnie and Mark were the first two members originally recruited into NKOTB by producer Maurice Starr. But when Starr wanted the group to focus on ballads instead of rap, Mark (who wasn’t a singer) quit. A few years later he had dropped out of school and was involved in shoplifting and street fights (later referring to his younger self as a ‘trainwreck’).

When Donnie came home from touring, he kept his promise and wrote “Good Vibrations” with his brother Mark and friend Amir Quadeer “MC Spice” Shakir. The three produced a demo tape that radio promotion executive Marc Benesch forwarded to Interscope Records co-founder Jimmy Iovine, who loved it, signed Mark to a record deal and put the brothers into a studio to record a full album.

The track includes samples from Loleatta Holloway’s #1 Dance Track “Love Sensation”. Whereas other hits like Samantha Fox’s “I Wanna Have Some Fun” and Blackbox’s “I Don’t Know Anybody Else” had already borrowed from the track without crediting Holloway, the Wahlbergs not only included her name on the release, but also asked her to appear in the song’s music video and perform on stage with them live on The Arsenio Hall Show.

Originally Mark wanted his track “Wildside” to be his debut single but the record company insisted on “Good Vibrations” instead, which reached the top 20 in fifteen countries, was certified Gold in the US, and Billboard ranked it the #20 song of 1991. “Wildside” was the follow-up and it fared admirably, reaching the top 40 in nine countries and was also certified Gold.

When Donnie came home from touring, he kept his promise and wrote “Good Vibrations” with his brother Mark and friend Amir Quadeer “MC Spice” Shakir. The three produced a demo tape that radio promotion executive Marc Benesch forwarded to Interscope Records co-founder Jimmy Iovine, who loved it, signed Mark to a record deal and put the brothers into a studio to record a full album.

The track includes samples from Loleatta Holloway’s #1 Dance Track “Love Sensation”. Whereas other hits like Samantha Fox’s “I Wanna Have Some Fun” and Blackbox’s “I Don’t Know Anybody Else” had already borrowed from the track without crediting Holloway, the Wahlbergs not only included her name on the release, but also asked her to appear in the song’s music video and perform on stage with them live on The Arsenio Hall Show.

songs.artist_names: Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch
songs.full_title: Wildside by Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch
songs.title: Wildside

primary_artist.name: Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch

description.plain:
Wildside is a track made by Marky Mark and the funky bunch released in 1991.



In this song, the band warns people about how dangerous certain things can get. The “Wildside” that they are referring to means a lifestyle of doing crimes, drugs, and other dangerous activities. They warn how unlucky certain people can be simply because they tried to do something bad. They are also pointing out just how greedy some people can be and harmful stereotypes that affect us today.

body.plain:
Wildside is a track made by Marky Mark and the funky bunch released in 1991.



In this song, the band warns people about how dangerous certain things can get. The “Wildside” that they are referring to means a lifestyle of doing crimes, drugs, and other dangerous activities. They warn how unlucky certain people can be simply because they tried to do something bad. They are also pointing out just how greedy some people can be and harmful stereotypes that affect us today.

songs.full_title: Walk on the Wild Side by Lou Reed
songs.title: Walk on the Wild Side

songs.artist: Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch
songs.lyrics:
Wildside LyricsAh yeah huh American the beautiful
Huh yeah let me introduce y'all to the wildside
Annie was a high school cheerleader
Pom poms and bobby socks and no girl was sweeter
Come prom time everybody was on the line
All the fellas singing nickel and dime
Tales about love and lust and trust
But Annie took it in all in stride
Cause deep inside annie had aspirations
Wanted to be a chemical engineer
Making 50 to 55 thousand a year
Her first year of college was a success
But along came Billy possessed and obsessed
He took Annie on a fatal date
And showed her things that made heart beats accelerate
Annie took a hit breathed two short breaths
One for life the last for death
Now she's gone a former valedictorian
Ended up becoming a topic for historians
Washed up dreams, shattered pride
All because Annie took a hit on the wildside
(Chorus)

Ron had enough of being broke every day
Saying to himself. There's gotta be a better way
Cause 9 to 5 wasn't worth the headaches
So ron figured out a faster way to make money
Before you know it, he's a rich man
Gold on every finger of his hand
A brand new BMW. A condo. Ron ended up a john doe
A body was found in the alley but never claimed
Full of bullet holes but none to blame
Ron became another victim of homicide
Because he chose to walk on the wildside

(Chorus)

Charles had everything going for him
A top paying job a good life. A good wife
A baby boy on the way any day
A gentleman attitude is all he displayed
Carol was the wife he loved and adored
Her family and friends treated him like an ambassador
One night on the other side of town
A police dispatcher picked up a weird sound
Charles on the car phone asking for help
Claiming a burglar shot his wife and himself
His pregnant wife lay slumped over
Dreams corrupt and a young life over
Extensive searches throughout the projects
Put a lot of people through misery and wreck
Everyone a suspect till someone was found
Interrogated cause their skin was brown
Then there was Benny, guilty until proven so
But soon as the case started moving slow
What do you know, sure as a sea gull gets webbed toed
Charles was the culprit
The whole plot was an insurance scam
Charles and his brother came up with a plan
Kill carol collect a big check
Blame it on a black man. What the heck!
And just before the story was known
Charles had a feeling his cover was blown
So he jumped off a bridge
Committed suicide
This is how it is on the wildside!
You might also like(Chorus)

Little Tiffany. Only thirteen
Came to the city. Place of big dreams
Visiting family and friends for the summer time
Sitting on a mailbox, watching the boys climb trees
And the girls play hopscotch
So far her vacation was top notch
But of the blue a Mercedes at top speed
Gang bangers chasing the robbers on the stampede
Quick as a blink shots rang out loud
And a hail of bullets zipped through the crowd
One hit Tiffany and instantly she died
Innocently on the wildside3Embed

songs.lyrics:
Bout Time I Funk You Lyrics[Intro]
Ah, yeah
(It’s bout time I funk you, baby)
It’s about that time, baby
Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch are in the house
You know what I’m saying?
(It’s bout time I funk you, baby)
Yo, baby boy, you with it?
(Yeah)
Cool, here we go
[Hook]
Bout time I funk you, baby
Bout time I funk you, baby

Well, it’s about that time that we start this thing
You want funk?
Well, what the hell you’d think I’d bring?
Something crusty, something rusty or junky?
Come on, I make it funky
So funky that the girls start shaking their butts
So nasty that it’s driving me nuts
Come on, baby, you know what to do
‘Cause Marky Mark is gonna funk you

[Hook]
Bout time I funk you, baby
(I’m gonna make it real funky for you)
(I’m gonna make it real-)
Bout time I funk you, baby
(I’m gonna make it real funky for you)
(I’m gonna make it real funky for you)

You’ve waited years for something juicy and wet
Well, I’ma give you something you will never forget
Hey ladies, you wanna know how to please me?
Easy, sleazy
You don’t tease me, baby
I wanna dance with you
You ain’t with it?
Well, then forget you
I’ll find another honey who’s ready and willing to do the do
‘Cause Mark’s gonna funk her, too
You might also like[Hook]
Bout time I funk you, baby
(I’m gonna make it real funky for you)
(I’m gonna make it real-)
Bout time I funk you, baby
(I’m gonna make it real funky for you)
(I’m gonna make it real funky for you)

[Bridge: Marky Mark, Donnie Wahlberg, (Jordan Knight)]
I like your hips
Yeah, I like those hips, baby
I like your eyes
(Hey, yeah, yeah)
I love those big, brown eyes
I like your lips
I love those juicy, red lips, baby
I like your @*#!
(Hey, yeah, hey, yeah)
That’s not all I like
Get busy

[Instrumental]

[Breakdown]
Yo DJ D, break it down one time
We’re getting funky
(Ain’t it funky)
Funky
(Ain’t it funky)
We’re getting funky
(Ain’t it funky)
Funky
(Ain’t it funky)
I’m gonna make it real funky for you
[Verse 3: Marky Mark, Donnie Wahlberg]
Yo Marky Mark, why don’t you give a shoutout to the fellas?
You’re taking all their girlies and they’re starting to get jealous
That’s cause all night long
You’ve been sitting around, doing nothing
So get off your butts and stop frontin’
You’re acting like a wallflower, what a crime it is
Come here, boy, let me show you what time it is
Fellas, this is your chance to find romance
So stop sitting around and just dance
Feel the beat, move and get loose
See a fly cutie and seduce
Don’t be shy, guy, you gotta try
Spot that honey, now look in her the eye
Now slide on in for the kill
Stop sweating, man you gots to chill
Grab a girl by the hand, you know what to do
Get funky while the Funky Bunch funks you

[Interlude]
(It’s bout time I funk you, baby)
Ah, yeah
You wanna funk, I gave it to you, baby
Come on
(It’s bout time I funk you, baby)
Yo, we’re gonna wind up one more time
Check it out

[Hook]
Bout time I funk you, baby
(I’m gonna make it real funky for you)
(I’m gonna make it real-)
Bout time I funk you, baby
(I’m gonna make it real funky for you)

[Outro: Marky Mark, Donnie Wahlberg]
Everybody get funky
(Just give me the funk)
Just give me the funk, now, yeah
(To the funk you up)
I’m gonna funky, funk you up, yeah
(Just give me the funk)
(To the funk you up
Just give me the funk)
Just give me the funk, now
(To the funk you up
Just give me the funk)Embed

I wanna see everybodyout there dance, come on now

songs.artist_names: Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch (Ft. Donnie Wahlberg)
songs.full_title: Loungin' by Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch (Ft. Donnie Wahlberg)
songs.title: Loungin’

primary_artist.name: Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch

description.plain: “Loungin'”, the 4th track in Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch’s last album “You Gotta Believe” features Marky Mark’s brother, Donnie Wahlberg, rapping in the 2nd verse, with Mark rapping on the 1st and 3rd verses. The main sample in this song is “I’m Chief Kamanawanalea (We’re the Royal Macadamia Nuts)” by The Turtles.

The main sample in this song is “I’m Chief Kamanawanalea (We’re the Royal Macadamia Nuts)” by The Turtles.

songs.lyrics:
Super Cool Mack Daddy Lyrics[Intro]

[Verse 1: Marky Mark]

Check, check it one time
Never wanted to rip a rhyme this much in my life
But mugs act trife and try to live supercool
Freeze 'em they might as well been frostin’
'Cause I'm the baddest white boy in Boston
Be on tour chumps be back at home tryin’ to front
But that's all right though
Front the way you fucking want
Most of all be tryin' to act up for what?
Sweatin' anybody in the neighborhood who drops a cut
Your ass is to busy hockin' the next man
Word to Don you should be worrying about tryin' to expand
Yes I'm the Mack steady havin' ruff raps for your tracks
I’m all that, and plus it keeps my pockets fat
Your bum rush couldn’t stop me if you got me
Your words are too choppy and your crews rolls sloppy
Yo that's enough shit to drive your ass batty
Marky Mark A Super Cool Mack Daddy
[Chorus]

Super Cool Mack Daddy (That’s amazin')
Super Cool Mack Daddy (Back again)
Super Cool Mack Daddy (That's amazin')
Super Cool Mack Daddy (Back again)

Well it’s me MC Mark-O Cherokee Jeep, black like charcoal
With the kit ya hear my shit throughout your district
So you figure you wanna do with this white boy cooly
You bes' a go run get your tooly
And the first one to step is gettin' snuffed
Cock diesel ruff and tuff you can't get enough
Raps are ran like a marathon runner makes you wonder what crew
I'm rollin under?
Cheezy rat, Donnie D production force is
All about makin' amends with no losses
But of course you're gonna sweat I'll make you
Sweat me, that's right chump I'll make you never forget me
Hell no I'm not a rap devil going out like rebel
And when it comes to rhymes I got several
No sleep I'm up in the morning like Matty
[?] right a Super Cool Mack Daddy
You might also like[Chorus]

Super Cool Mack Daddy (That's amazin')
Super Cool Mack Daddy (Back again)
Super Cool Mack Daddy (That's amazin')
Super Cool Mack Daddy (Back again)

[Verse 3: Marky Mark]

Livin' like a gangster kid you can see me
I'm mackin' like a pro when I rip like so
I roll through the streets pumpin' tracks by the crew
I used to drink a brew
But now I like to rip a show or two
See I'm coolin' much harder than your father
But kids still sweat me, tryin' to upset me. Why Bother?
This time around I'm stompin' heads in the ground
Like a soldier, so kid don't say i never told ya
You never thought the M.W. could bring trouble to your block
With crazy ruff rhymes in stock
I'm in there like a strong gust of wind yeah
Cuttin' through your crew like the hawk when I spark
The dark shit Monk-D's prone to drop hits
Leaving all them mugs on my [?] with fits
You hear my Cherokee comin' from three blocks fat
It rocks gee
A crazy Super Cool Mack Daddy!
[Chorus]

Super Cool Mack Daddy (That's amazin')
Super Cool Mack Daddy (Back again)
Super Cool Mack Daddy (That's amazin')
Super Cool Mack Daddy (Back again)Embed
